content: Here is the Mentimeter link where you can submit questions for the panelists.

Re: Emily's comment about Galois. There is a book The Genesis of the Abstract Group Concept that gives some history on this topic. (I am not a mathematician, maybe others have reading suggestions too). There is also a book from the European Mathematical Society that transcribes his writings (side by side French and an English translation) complete with misprints, strikethoughs, etc. It is very interesting to see how he thought of Galois theory in his time and how it subsequently developed.
@Chris Henson so did I recall the history more or less correctly? I may this point again in the future so if the details are slightly wrong I'd love to be corrected... :)
Yes, I would call your description essentially correct!
